title: Working Hours
description: Students with a valid immigration Stamp 2 permit can work 40 hours per week only during June, July, August, and September, as well as from 15 December to 15 January inclusive. During the rest of the year, students with Immigration permit Stamp 2 will be limited to working 20 hours per week.

title: Natural Beauty
description: Ireland, also known as the 'Emerald Island,' is home to hundreds of breathtaking sights, views, and experiences. Plus, because the island is so small, you’re never more than a few hours’ drive from breathtaking scenery, and chances are you’ll stop along the way to see something you didn’t plan for or expect to see.

title: Safe country
description: Ireland is a safe place to live, consistently ranking in the top 20 countries in the world for quality of life, peace, and human development. It is also a young country, with one-third of the population under the age of 25. The welcoming nature of the Irish people makes it easier for international students to feel at home.

title: Education Quality
description: Ireland has one of the best educational systems in the world and there are many reasons to study in Ireland. Irish universities offer both undergraduate and postgraduate programs in related fields. The quality of the syllabus, as well as the standard of teaching and research, are unmatched anywhere in the world.

title: Work Opportunities
description: Ireland’s government offers a post-study work visa to students who complete their graduation at an Irish university. This visa lets you work in Ireland for an initial period of years after which you can apply for reside in Ireland on a longer-term visa.Many international graduates use this opportunity to gain valuable work experience and build a career in Ireland.
